metadata.title: CVE-2017-14226 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
WP1StylesListener.cpp, WP5StylesListener.cpp, and WP42StylesListener.cpp inlibwpd 0.10.1 mishandle iterators, which allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (heap-based buffer over-read in the WPXTableList class inWPXTable.cpp). This vulnerability can be triggered in LibreOffice before5.3.7. It may lead to suffering a remote attack against a LibreOfficeapplication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwpd-0.10-10 - 0.10.2-3
libwpd-tools - 0.10.2-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libwpd package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.10.2-3').
